subsection.content: for a period of 5 years or such other period as may be determined by the Council. (Replaced L.N. 186 of 2003)

section.name: s1A
section.content: A Dean shall be eligible for re-appointment. (Added L.N. 186 of 2003)

section.name: s2
section.content: Whenever the office of Dean becomes vacant a new Dean shall forthwith be appointed.

section.name: s3
section.content: The Dean shall be a member of all committees of the Board of the Faculty and shall present candidates for degrees (except honorary degrees) in the subjects of the Faculty. (Replaced L.N. 299 of 1998)

section.name: s4
section.content: A Dean may resign by written notice addressed to the Council. (Replaced L.N. 299 of 1998)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Associate Deans of each Faculty shall be appointed by the Dean of the Faculty. (Amended L.N. 299 of 1998)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: The period of office of an Associate Dean of a Faculty shall be determined by the Dean of the Faculty and shall not exceed or be extended beyond the period of office of the Dean. (Amended L.N. 83 of 1992)

section.name: s6
section.content: An Associate Dean of a Faculty shall discharge such duties as may be determined by the Dean of the Faculty. (Amended L.N. 83 of 1992)

section.name: s7
section.content: An Associate Dean of a Faculty may resign by written notice addressed to the Dean of the Faculty. (Amended L.N. 83 of 1992)

editorialNote.content: * For the transitional provision relating to the amendments made by the Statutes of the University of Hong Kong (Amendment) (No. 2) Statutes 2003 (L.N. 186 of 2003), see section 14 of the Statutes.

section.name: s1
section.content: The Dean of Student Affairs shall be an officer and shall be appointed by the Council after consultation with the Senate.

section.name: s2
section.content: The Dean of Student Affairs shall be responsible to the Vice-Chancellor for such duties in connection with student affairs as may be determined by the Council from time to time. (Replaced L.N. 4 of 1983)

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be appointed by the Council;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall keep a register of all members of the University under their respective qualifications as specified in Statute IV;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall be the custodian of the records and of the common seal of the University; (Replaced L.N. 167 of 1992)

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: may exercise his functions as secretary to the Boards of the Faculties by deputy. (Amended L.N. 72 of 1993)

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: The Director of Finance shall be an officer, and— (Amended L.N. 72 of 1993)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be appointed by the Council;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be responsible to the Council for the keeping of all University accounts;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall be responsible to the Vice-Chancellor for the discharge of such other duties in connection with University finance as the Vice-Chancellor may determine. (Amended L.N. 165 of 1999)

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: The Librarian—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be appointed by the Council after consultation with the Senate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall discharge such duties as may be determined by the Council after consultation with the Senate.

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: The Director of Estates shall be an officer, and— (Amended L.N. 15 of 1973; L.N. 72 of 1993)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be appointed by the Council;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be responsible to the Vice-Chancellor for general maintenance of all University buildings, properties, and grounds;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall be responsible to the Vice-Chancellor for the discharge of such other duties in connection with the University buildings, properties, and grounds as the Vice-Chancellor may determine. (Replaced L.N. 56 of 1966. Amended L.N. 167 of 1992; L.N. 165 of 1999)

section.name: s1
section.content: The Court shall appoint an auditor or auditors, who shall not be members of the Court, the Council, the Senate, the Board of any Faculty or any committee. (Amended L.N. 58 of 1976; L.N. 72 of 1993)

section.name: s2
section.content: Auditors shall hold office for 1 year at a time, and shall be eligible for re-appointment.

section.name: s1
section.content: In addition to the persons designated as such by the Ordinance, the appointed Deans of Faculties and the Heads and Deputy Heads of the Institutes, Schools, Centres and Units and other subdivisions of Studies and Learning appointed under the provisions of Statute XXV shall be teachers. (Replaced L.N. 72 of 1993. Amended L.N. 123 of 1994; L.N. 299 of 1998; 20 of 2011 s. 4)

section.name: s2
section.content: The teachers whose services are exclusively at the disposal of the University shall not during the tenure of their appointments engage in outside practice for reward without the consent of the Council.

section.name: s3
section.content: The Senate shall organize the teachers into such Faculties, Teaching Departments, Institutes, Schools, Centres, and Units and other subdivisions of studies and learning as the Senate shall see fit. (Replaced L.N. 123 of 1994. Amended L.N. 299 of 1998)

section.name: s1
section.content: Upon the recommendation of the Senate, the Council may appoint Honorary Professors and may confer the title of Emeritus Professor upon any professor who has retired from office.

section.name: s2
section.content: An Honorary or Emeritus Professor shall not ex officio be a member of the Court, Council, Senate or the Board of any Faculty. (Replaced L.N. 72 of 1993)

section.name: s1
section.content: Except as provided in the statutes, in the absence of the president or chairman and, if there is a vice-president or vice-chairman, of the vice-president or vice-chairman from a meeting of the Court, Council, Senate, the Board of any Faculty, or any committee, the members present at that meeting shall choose a president or chairman, as the case may be, to act at that meeting. (Amended L.N. 69 of 1968)

section.name: s2
section.content: Except as provided in the statutes, the Court, Council, Senate, Boards of the Faculties, and any committee shall determine and may make rules for the time, place, and procedure of their respective meetings.

section.name: s3
section.content: The minutes of all meetings of every committee held since the last preceding meeting of the parent body shall be laid on the table at each meeting of that body, whether it be the Court, Council, Senate or the Board of any Faculty.

section.name: s4
section.content: The minutes of all meetings of the Boards of the Faculties held since the last preceding meeting of the Senate shall be laid on the table at each meeting of the Senate.

section.name: s5
section.content: The minutes of all meetings of the Court shall be sent to Convocation.

section.name: s6
section.content: In the case of equality of votes on a question at a meeting of the Court, Council, Senate, the Board of any Faculty or any committee, the president or chairman of the meeting shall have a casting vote.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The Court shall consist of—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: life members;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the following members ex officio:
the members of the Council,
the members of the Senate,
the Registrar,

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: 5 persons elected by the Members of the Legislative Council from among their own number, (Replaced 67 of 1987 s. 2. Amended L.N. 99 of 1997)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: 12 members elected from among its number by the Standing Committee of Convocation; provided that no member of that committee who is a member of the Court by virtue of any other paragraph of this Statute shall be eligible for election, (Replaced L.N. 44 of 1985)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: 3 members elected by the Grant Schools Council from among its number, (Amended L.N. 82 of 1979; L.N. 165 of 1999)

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: 3 members elected by the Hong Kong Subsidized Secondary Schools Council from among its number; and (Added L.N. 56 of 1986. Amended L.N. 165 of 1999)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: not more than 20 members, not being already included in any of the foregoing classes, appointed by the Chancellor.

section.name: s2
section.content: Vacancies shall be filled as they occur or as soon thereafter as conveniently may be.

section.name: s3
section.content: Any member of the Court except an ex officio member may resign by written notice addressed to the secretary to the Court. (Amended L.N. 58 of 1976)

section.name: s4
section.content: The ex officio members shall continue members so long only as they hold the office in virtue of which they became members of the Court.

section.name: s5
section.content: The elected members shall hold office for 3 years at a time and shall be eligible for re-election.

section.name: s6
section.content: The appointed members shall hold office for 3 years at a time and shall be eligible for re-appointment.

section.name: s7
section.content: The Registrar shall be the secretary to the Court. (Replaced L.N. 58 of 1976. Amended L.N. 167 of 1992)

section.name: s8
section.content: If any appointed or elected member leaves Hong Kong and either remains absent for 3 months or more or gives notice of his intended absence for 3 months or more the appointing or electing person or body may appoint or elect, as the case may require, another person to act as member in his place during his absence. The acting member shall vacate his office either on the return of the absent member to Hong Kong, or on the expiry of the absent member’s term of office, whichever first happens. (Amended L.N. 32 of 1987)

section.name: s9
section.leadIn: A member elected under paragraph 1(d)(i), (ii), (iv) or (v) of this Statute shall be deemed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to have resigned from the Court if he ceases to be a member of the body which elected him;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to have resigned from his membership of the Court in that capacity if he becomes a member of the Court in another capacity. (Added L.N. 44 of 1985. Amended L.N. 165 of 1999)

section.name: s1
section.content: The Court shall meet at least once in each academic year.

section.name: s2
section.content: The Chancellor shall be the president of the Court. In the absence of the Chancellor the Pro-Chancellor or in the absence of both of them the Vice-Chancellor, shall preside at a meeting of the Court. (Replaced L.N. 69 of 1968)

section.name: s3
section.content: The Chancellor may convene a meeting of the Court at any time.

section.name: s4
section.content: One-fourth of the members of the Court for the time being shall form a quorum.

section.name: s5
section.content: The Vice-Chancellor may require any officer or teacher to be present at a meeting of the Court to assist the Vice-Chancellor or the Registrar. (Amended L.N. 167 of 1992)

section.name: s0
section.leadIn: Subject to the provisions of the Ordinance and the statutes, the Court shall have power—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to recommend to the Chancellor additions to, or the amendment or repeal of any of the statutes on the proposal of the Council;

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: to elect, in accordance with regulations, its members to be members of the Council and to, on the recommendation of the Council, give the approval referred to in paragraph 2 of Statute XVIII; (Added L.N. 186 of 2003)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to consider the annual accounts together with any comments that may have been made by the auditors;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to consider any reports that may be made by the Council to the Court;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to discuss any motion on general University policy that may be introduced by a member; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to appoint life members and to prescribe the procedure for making such appointments.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The Council shall consist of—

subsection.name: a
b
subsection.content: 6 persons, not being students or employees of the University, appointed by the Council;

subsection.name: c
subsection.content: 2 persons, not being students or employees of the University, elected by the Court under sub-subparagraph (ba) of Statute XVII;

subsection.name: d
subsection.content: the Vice-Chancellor;

subsection.name: e
subsection.content: the Treasurer;

subsection.name: f
subsection.content: 4 full-time teachers elected in accordance with regulations;

subsection.name: g
subsection.content: 1 full-time employee of the University, not being a teacher, elected in accordance with regulations;

subsection.name: h
subsection.content: 1 full-time undergraduate student elected in accordance with regulations; and

subsection.name: i
subsection.content: 1 full-time postgraduate student elected in accordance with regulations. (Replaced L.N. 186 of 2003)

section.name: s1A
section.content: The Registrar shall be the secretary to the Council but shall not be a member thereof. (Added L.N. 58 of 1976. Amended L.N. 167 of 1992)

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: A member referred to in paragraph 1(a), (b), (c), (e), (f) or (g)—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: shall serve for a term of 3 years;

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: shall be eligible for re-appointment or re-election but no member may serve more than 3 consecutive terms without approval of the Court; and

subsection.name: c
subsection.content: may resign by written notice addressed to the Registrar. (Replaced L.N. 186 of 2003)

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: A member referred to in paragraph 1(h) or (i)—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: shall serve for a term as determined by the Council from time to time;

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: shall be eligible for re-election;

subsection.name: c
subsection.content: may resign by written notice addressed to the Registrar; and

subsection.name: d
subsection.content: shall cease to be a member when he ceases to be a full-time student of the University. (Replaced L.N. 186 of 2003)

section.name: s5
section.content: Not less than one third of the members of the Council shall constitute a quorum at any meeting of the Council. (Replaced L.N. 186 of 2003)

section.name: s6
section.content: The powers of the Council may be exercised notwithstanding any vacancy in its number, but if at any time and as long as the number of members of the Council is less than 10 the Council shall discontinue the exercise of its powers.

section.name: s7
section.content: The Chairman may require any officer or teacher to be present at a meeting of the Council. (Amended L.N. 137 of 1967)

editorialNote.content: * For the transitional provision relating to the amendments made by the Statutes of the University of Hong Kong (Amendment) (No. 2) Statutes 2003 (L.N. 186 of 2003), see section 14 of the Statutes.

section.name: s1
section.content: The Council may exercise all the powers and is to perform all the duties of the University other than those vested or imposed by the Ordinance or the statutes in some other authority of the University or in an officer. (Amended 20 of 2011 s. 4)

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: Notwithstanding the generality of the powers vested in the Council by paragraph 1 and subject to the provisions of the Ordinance and the statutes, the Council shall have power—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to administer and manage the finances, accounts, investments, property, business, and all affairs whatsoever of the University, and for that purpose to appoint bankers, counsel, solicitors, and such officers or agents as it may be expedient to appoint;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to invest the moneys of the University, including any unapplied income, in such stocks, funds, fully paid-up shares or securities, mortgages, or debentures or debenture stock as the Council shall think fit, whether such investments be authorized by the general law for the investment of trust moneys or not, and whether such investments be within Hong Kong or not, and to invest such moneys in the purchase of leasehold property in Hong Kong, and to vary any investments by sale and reinvestment or otherwise; (Amended L.N. 32 of 1987)

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: to provide the buildings, premises, furniture, apparatus, and other means needed for the University;

content.leadIn: to borrow money on behalf of the University and for that purpose to mortgage all or any part of the property of the University, whether real or personal, or give such other security, whether upon such real or personal property or otherwise, as it thinks fit:
content.proviso: Provided that the moneys borrowed and owing by the University shall not at any time exceed in the whole the sum of $100,000 except with the sanction of a resolution passed at a meeting of the Council and confirmed by the vote of three-fourths of the members present and voting at a subsequent meeting of the Council specially convened for the purpose and held not less than 7 days after the former meeting;

paragraph.name: fa
paragraph.content: to accept and execute, and to appoint any officer of the University or any trust company to accept and execute, the office of trustee, or other like office of a fiduciary nature, of any trust or unit trust in which the University, officers, teachers or other employees or students of the University have a beneficial interest whether directly or indirectly including any superannuation fund or pension scheme for the benefit of employees of the University; (Added L.N. 72 of 1993. Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

paragraph.name: fb
paragraph.content: to incorporate a trust company to accept and execute the office of trustee, or other like office of a fiduciary nature, of any trust or unit trust in which the University, officers, teachers or other employees or students of the University have a beneficial interest whether directly or indirectly, and to act as investing or financial agent and receive money in trust for investment and to allow interest thereon until invested; (Added L.N. 72 of 1993)

paragraph.name: fc
g
paragraph.content: to enter into, vary, carry out, and cancel contracts on behalf of the University;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: to maintain a University printing press and publish books and other matter on behalf of the University;

paragraph.name: i
j
paragraph.content: in consultation with the Senate to review the instruction and teaching of the University;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: to co-operate with other Universities and authorities for the regulation and conduct of examinations, for the examination and inspection of schools and other academic institutions, for the extension of University teaching, and for other purposes;

content.leadIn: to appoint any person or committee to entertain and, if appropriate, adjudicate upon, on its behalf, complaints from members of the University and persons employed in it and to redress their grievances: (Amended L.N. 186 of 2003; L.N. 246 of 2003)
content.proviso: Provided that the Council shall not entertain or adjudicate upon any complaint which falls within the jurisdiction of the Disciplinary Committee; (Replaced L.N. 19 of 1971)

paragraph.name: la
paragraph.content: to allow or dismiss an appeal from the Disciplinary Committee and to vary any penalty imposed by the Disciplinary Committee, or to appoint any person or committee to discharge those duties; (Added L.N. 19 of 1971. Amended L.N. 186 of 2003)

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: to propose to the Court additions to, or the amendment or repeal of any of the statutes;

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: to draft statutes;

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: to prescribe fees;

paragraph.name: p
pa
paragraph.content: to grant loans, whether secured or unsecured and in such amounts and on such terms and conditions as it thinks fit, to officers, teachers and other employees whom it may appoint; (Added L.N. 115 of 1991)

paragraph.name: q
paragraph.content: to appoint committees within or without Hong Kong to select candidates for any office to which the Council may appoint; (Amended L.N. 32 of 1987)

paragraph.name: r
paragraph.content: to delegate any of its powers to any member of the Council or to any committee thereof or to any officer or teacher;

paragraph.name: s
paragraph.content: to do all such acts and things and perform all such duties as may be necessary for or incidental to exercising the powers or performing the duties vested or imposed on the Council by the Ordinance or the statutes. (Added 20 of 2011 s. 4)

subsection.leadIn: The Council may by regulation provide for any of the following matters or for any of the following purposes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the administration of the affairs of the University;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the form of contracts;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the University press and publications;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: fees;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the conduct of elections and the mode of appointments prescribed by the Ordinance and the statutes; (Amended L.N. 186 of 2003)

paragraph.name: f
g
paragraph.content: generally, all matters which by the Ordinance or the statutes it is empowered to regulate.

subsection.content: All such regulations shall come into operation on the day on which they are made, unless otherwise provided by the Council.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The Honorary Degrees Committee shall consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Pro-Chancellor, who shall be Chairman;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Vice-Chancellor, who shall be Vice-Chairman;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a graduate, appointed by the Court, on whom an honorary degree has been conferred;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: 2 members of the Council, appointed by the Council, who are members of the Council under paragraph 1(a), (b), (c) or (e) of Statute XVIII, and of whom at least 1 is a graduate; (Replaced L.N. 490 of 1997. Amended L.N. 186 of 2003)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: 3 Deans of Faculties, elected by the Senate; and (Added L.N. 490 of 1997)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a Director of The University of Hong Kong Foundation for Educational Development and Research Limited, appointed by resolution of the Board of that Foundation. (Added L.N. 490 of 1997)

subsection.content: The persons appointed under paragraph 1(c), (d) and (f) shall hold office for a period of 3 years, shall be eligible for reappointment, and may resign by written notice addressed to the Registrar.

The persons elected under paragraph 1(e) shall hold office for a period of 3 years, shall be eligible for re-election, and may resign by written notice addressed to the Registrar. (Replaced L.N. 490 of 1997)

section.name: s3
section.content: The Registrar shall be the secretary to the Honorary Degrees Committee but shall not be a member thereof. (Replaced L.N. 58 of 1976)

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: The Honorary Degrees Committee may recommend to the Chancellor the award of honorary degrees to persons who have made, in the opinion of the Honorary Degrees Committee, a contribution of distinction in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: services to the University; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: services to the Hong Kong community; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: services to academia. (Added L.N. 490 of 1997)

section.name: s5
section.content: The Honorary Degrees Committee shall seek from the members of the Court nominations for the award of honorary degrees, and shall have power to receive nominations from any other person or organization. (Added L.N. 490 of 1997)

section.name: s1
section.content: The Council shall fix the financial year.

section.name: s2
section.content: The Council shall appoint a Finance Committee, to which persons who are not members of the Council may be appointed, and all matters within the jurisdiction of the Council which have important financial implications shall stand referred to the Finance Committee.

section.name: s3
section.content: The Finance Committee shall submit to the Council, before the beginning of the financial year, draft estimates of income and expenditure, and such estimates, amended as the Council may think fit, shall be approved by the Council before the beginning of the financial year.

section.name: s4
section.content: The estimate shall show the income and expenditure of the University and the estimated surplus or deficit for the year. The estimated expenditure shall be shown under votes, heads, and (where applicable) sub-heads. The Council shall make regulations for the preparation of the estimates and for the control of expenditure within them. The Council may revise the estimates during the course of the financial year, and may make regulations for the amendment of the expenditure estimates. Such last mentioned regulations may make provision for delegating the said powers of revision so long as such delegation shall not extend to altering the total estimated expenditure. (Replaced L.N. 137 of 1967)

section.name: s5
section.content: As soon as practicable after the end of the financial year, a Balance Sheet and Income and Expenditure Account with supporting schedules shall be submitted to the auditors.

section.name: s6
section.content: The audited accounts, with any comments thereon made by the auditors, shall be submitted to the Council.

section.name: s7
section.content: But nothing in this statute shall deprive the Council of power to invest surpluses or prospective surpluses at any time.

section.name: s8
section.content: The audited account shall be submitted to the Court at its annual meeting. (Replaced L.N. 186 of 2003)

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The Senate shall consist of—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: the Vice-Chancellor, who shall be the chairman;

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: the Deputy Vice-Chancellor;

subsection.name: c
subsection.content: the Pro-Vice-Chancellors;

subsection.name: d
subsection.content: the Dean of each Faculty;

subsection.name: e
subsection.content: the Chairman of each Board of the Faculty;

subsection.name: f
subsection.content: 12 Professors elected in accordance with regulations;

subsection.name: g
subsection.content: 6 teachers, not being Professors, elected in accordance with regulations;

subsection.name: h
subsection.content: the Director of the School of Professional and Continuing Education of the University;

subsection.name: i
subsection.content: the Dean of the Graduate School;

subsection.name: j
subsection.content: the Librarian;

subsection.name: k
subsection.content: the Dean of Student Affairs; and

subsection.name: l
subsection.content: 3 full-time students, at least one of whom shall be an undergraduate and one of whom shall be a postgraduate, elected in accordance with regulations. (Replaced L.N. 186 of 2003)

section.name: s2
section.content: The Senate has power to co-opt other members of the University to serve as members of the Senate for such periods as the Senate may determine, provided that at any one time the total number of serving members of the Senate does not exceed 50. (Replaced L.N. 186 of 2003)

section.name: s4
section.content: The Senate shall meet at least once in each semester of every academic year, and at such other times as may be necessary. (Amended L.N. 516 of 1994)

section.name: s5
section.content: Not less than one third of the members of the Senate shall constitute a quorum at any meeting of the Senate. (Replaced L.N. 186 of 2003)

section.name: s6
section.content: The chairman shall be empowered to require any officer or teacher to attend a meeting of the Senate.

section.name: s7
section.content: The Registrar shall be the secretary to the Senate but shall not be a member thereof. (Replaced L.N. 58 of 1976)

editorialNote.content: * For the transitional provision relating to the amendments made by the Statutes of the University of Hong Kong (Amendment) (No. 2) Statutes 2003 (L.N. 186 of 2003), see section 14 of the Statutes.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: Subject to the provision of the Ordinance and the statutes, and to the availability of the funds provided by the Council, the Senate shall have power—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in consultation with the Boards of Faculties to provide courses of study for the degrees, diplomas, certificates, and other awards by the University and such other courses of study as may be thought desirable, to direct and regulate the instruction and education in the University, to stimulate the advancement of knowledge by research and publications, and to direct the manner in which examinations shall be conducted; (Amended L.N. 72 of 1993)

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: to advise the Council on the provision of facilities for educational and other academic matters;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to decide in accordance with the statutes and regulations what persons have qualified for the conferment of degrees (other than honorary degrees), and the award of diplomas, certificates, and other marks of distinction;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to organize the Faculties and to review, refer back, control, amend or disallow any act of the Board of any Faculty, and to give directions to the Boards of the Faculties; (Amended L.N. 72 of 1993)

paragraph.name: f
g
paragraph.content: to recommend any person for appointment to the post of teacher;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: to manage the libraries, laboratories, museums, and art galleries of the University;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: to provide for the welfare and discipline of students;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: to require any student on academic grounds to terminate his studies at the University;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: to determine the policy to be followed by the Halls of Residence maintained by the University; and to approve Halls and other accommodation for the residence of students not maintained by the University and to prescribe the conditions under which students may be permitted to reside therein;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: to provide lectures and courses of study for persons who are not members of the University;

paragraph.name: ma
paragraph.content: to entertain and adjudicate upon appeals on matters within the purview of the Senate, provided that the Senate shall not entertain appeals against decisions made by the examiners in connection with degrees, diplomas, certificates or other academic distinctions or attainments; (Added L.N. 490 of 1997)

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: to advise the Council on any matter which may be referred to the Senate by the Council;

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: to delegate any of its powers to any member of the Senate or any Committee thereof or the Board of any Faculty or to any officer or teacher; and (Amended L.N. 72 of 1993)

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: to do all such other acts and things as may be requisite to give effect to the powers conferred on the Senate by the Ordinance or the statutes. (Amended L.N. 58 of 1976)

subsection.leadIn: The Senate may by regulation provide for any of the following matters or for any of the following purposes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the admission, registration, residence, welfare, and discipline of students;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conditions for the award of degrees, diplomas, certificates, and other marks of distinction;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: courses of study and examinations;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: academic dress;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the award of scholarships and other educational endowments and prizes;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the use of the University libraries, laboratories, workshops, and other institutions;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the prescribing of anything which is by the Ordinance or the statutes to be prescribed by regulations made by the Senate;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the prescribing of conditions under which persons may be exempted from the provisions of any regulation made by the Senate; and

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: generally, all matters which by the Ordinance or the statutes it is empowered to regulate.

subsection.content: All such regulations shall be reported to the Council and shall come into operation not earlier than 1 semester after the day on which they are made, unless otherwise provided by the Council. (Amended L.N. 516 of 1994)

section.name: s1
section.content: The Teaching Departments shall be formed by the Senate.

section.name: s2
section.content: The Head of a Teaching Department allocated to a Faculty shall be appointed, with the concurrence of the Vice-Chancellor, by the Dean of the Faculty in accordance with regulations for a period determined in accordance with those regulations. (Replaced L.N. 186 of 2003)

section.name: s2A
section.content: The Head of a Teaching Department allocated to a Faculty shall be responsible to the Board of the Faculty for the organization of teaching in the Department. (Added L.N. 186 of 2003)

section.name: s3
section.content: The Senate shall allocate the Teaching Departments to Faculties. A Teaching Department may be allocated to more than one Faculty.

editorialNote.content: * For the transitional provision relating to the amendments made by the Statutes of the University of Hong Kong (Amendment) (No. 2) Statutes 2003 (L.N. 186 of 2003), see section 14 of the Statutes.

crossHeading.inline: Institutes, Schools, Centres, Units or Other

section.name: s1
section.content: The Head and any Deputy Head of an Institute, School, Centre, Unit or other subdivision of studies and learning shall be appointed by the Vice-Chancellor in accordance with regulations. (Amended L.N. 186 of 2003)

section.name: s2
section.content: An Institute, School, Centre, Unit or other subdivision of studies and learning may be allocated by the Senate to one or more Faculties.

editorialNote.content: * For the transitional provision relating to the amendments made by the Statutes of the University of Hong Kong (Amendment) (No. 2) Statutes 2003 (L.N. 186 of 2003), see section 14 of the Statutes.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The Board of each Faculty shall consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Vice-Chancellor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Chairman, who shall be a member of the Board of the Faculty other than the Dean or a member referred to in sub-subparagraph (g), elected by the members of the Board for a period of 3 years; (Replaced L.N. 299 of 1998. Amended L.N. 186 of 2003)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: the Dean of the Faculty; (Added L.N. 186 of 2003)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the teachers who are members of the Faculty and who are full-time employees of the University; (Replaced L.N. 299 of 1998)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: such other teachers as may be appointed to the Board by the Senate;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: such other persons not being teachers as may be appointed to the Board by the Senate on the recommendation of the Board, provided that the number of such persons shall not exceed one-fourth of the whole number of members of the Board;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: in respect of a Faculty in which the number of registered undergraduate students exceeds the number of registered postgraduate students, 3 undergraduate students who shall be registered in that Faculty to read full time for a degree, such undergraduate students being elected by the undergraduate students similarly so registered, and one postgraduate student, not being an officer or a teacher or a person employed by the University whose employment is permanent and full time or a member of the Board in any other category of membership, who shall be registered in that Faculty, such postgraduate student being elected by the postgraduate students similarly so registered; and, in respect of a Faculty in which the number of registered postgraduate students exceeds the number of registered undergraduate students, one undergraduate student who shall be registered in that Faculty, such undergraduate student being elected by the undergraduate students similarly so registered, and 3 postgraduate students, not being officers or teachers or persons employed by the University whose employment is permanent and full-time or members of the Board in any other category of membership, who shall be registered in that Faculty, such postgraduate students being elected by the postgraduate students similarly so registered. (Replaced L.N. 114 of 1989)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: The persons appointed under paragraph 1(d) and (e) shall hold office for a period of 3 years or for such other period as the Senate may specify in any particular case and shall be eligible for re-appointment. (Replaced L.N. 24 of 1984)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: The persons elected under paragraph 1(g) shall hold office for such periods as the Senate shall determine, and shall be eligible for re-election provided that no person shall be elected more than twice. (Amended L.N. 115 of 1991; L.N. 186 of 2003)

section.name: s3
section.content: The Board of each Faculty shall be responsible to the Senate for the teaching of the subjects assigned to that Faculty and shall report thereon to the Senate from time to time.

section.name: s4
section.content: The Registrar shall be the secretary to the Board of each Faculty but shall not be a member thereof. (Replaced L.N. 58 of 1976)

crossHeading.inline: Powers of the Boards of the Faculties

section.name: s0
section.leadIn: Subject to the provisions of the Ordinance and the statutes, the Board of each Faculty shall have power—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to advise the Senate on any questions relating to the work of the Faculty; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to do all such other acts and things as may be requisite to perform any duty which the Senate may delegate to it.

subsection.leadIn: Convocation shall consist of the following members—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chancellor, the Vice-Chancellor, the Deputy Vice-Chancellor, the Pro-Vice-Chancellors, the Treasurer, the Deans of the Faculties, the Dean of Student Affairs and the Registrar; (Replaced L.N. 19 of 1971. Amended L.N. 58 of 1976; L.N. 82 of 1979; L.N. 167 of 1992; L.N. 72 of 1993; L.N. 165 of 1999)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Chairs, Professors, Associate Professors, Assistant Professors, Readers, Senior Lecturers, Lecturers, Assistant Lecturers, Tutors and Demonstrators of the University; (Replaced 20 of 2011 s. 4)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: graduates of the University registered in accordance with regulations made by the Council. (Replaced L.N. 112 of 1969)

subsection.content: Persons on whom an honorary degree has been conferred shall not, solely by reason thereof, be members of Convocation, but may be elected by Convocation to be members thereof.

section.name: s2
section.content: A register of the members of Convocation shall be kept by the Registrar.

section.name: s3
section.content: Such register shall be conclusive evidence that any person whose name appears therein at the time of claiming to vote in Convocation is entitled to a vote and that any person whose name does not appear therein is not so entitled.

section.name: s4
section.content: The Chancellor, if present, shall preside at the meetings of Convocation.

section.name: s4A
section.content: There shall be a Standing Committee of Convocation which shall be the executive body of Convocation. (Added L.N. 15 of 1973)

section.name: s4B
section.content: There shall be a Chairman of Convocation who shall at the same time be chairman of the Standing Committee. (Added L.N. 15 of 1973)

section.name: s4C
section.content: Convocation may advise the Council on the rules for the time, place and procedure of its meetings and for the conduct of its office bearers and on the regulations for the conduct of Convocation elections. (Added L.N. 15 of 1973)

section.name: s5
section.content: A meeting of Convocation shall be convened at least once in every year and at such other times at the Standing Committee of Convocation may determine. (Amended L.N. 32 of 1981)

section.name: s6
section.content: A meeting of Convocation may also be convened by the direction of the Chairman thereof and shall be convened at the request in writing of at least 20 members.

section.name: s7
section.content: Notice of a meeting of Convocation shall be served in such manner as shall be prescribed by the Standing Committee from time to time. (Replaced L.N. 32 of 1981)

section.name: s8
section.content: 30 members of Convocation shall form a quorum.

section.name: s9
section.content: All questions which may arise at a meeting of Convocation shall be decided by a majority of votes of the members present and, in case of an equality of votes, the Chairman shall have a casting vote in addition to his original vote.

section.name: s10
section.leadIn: Convocation shall have the following powers—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to elect members of the Court from among their own number, in accordance with the provisions of Statute XV;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: to discuss any matter whatsoever relating to the University including any matter referred to it by the Court or the Council and to report its views on such matter to the Court or the Council or the Senate as the case may be;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: to enter into communication directly with the Court, the Council or the Senate on any matter affecting the University;

paragraph.name: ea
paragraph.content: to solicit funds from amongst its own members and from others for the purposes of the University and to determine the manner in which they may be made available in the form of scholarships, bursaries, or other forms of disbursement; (Added L.N. 15 of 1973)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: generally to do any other act necessary to give effect to the powers conferred on Convocation by the Ordinance or the statutes.

section.name: s1
section.content: Examinations for degrees, diplomas certificates and other awards shall be conducted by examiners appointed by the Council and the Senate on the recommendation of the appropriate Boards of Faculties, or committees of the Senate. (Amended L.N. 58 of 1976; L.N. 72 of 1993)

section.name: s2
section.content: In respect of every paper in a Degree Examination for a final year and in such other examinations as may be prescribed in accordance with the Ordinance, there shall be an external examiner appointed by the Council on the recommendation of the Senate, who shall not be a teacher.

section.name: s3
section.content: The Vice-Chancellor may in his absolute discretion appoint an examiner or, as the case may be, an external examiner for any examination whenever a vacancy or other emergency requiring such an immediate appointment occurs in relation to that examination.

section.name: s4
section.content: The Registrar shall discharge such duties in respect of examinations as may be delegated to him by the Senate, and he may perform these duties by deputy.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: In this statute, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: Committee (委員會) means the Disciplinary Committee appointed under paragraph 2;
teacher panel (教師小組) means the panel appointed under paragraph 3. (Added L.N. 112 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: The Disciplinary Committee shall consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 3 members appointed by the Registrar out of a teacher panel who have accepted appointment to serve on the Committee; and (Replaced L.N. 112 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 2 students appointed by the Registrar out of a student panel who have accepted appointment to serve on the Committee. (Replaced L.N. 112 of 2023)

subsection.content: The Registrar is to make appointments to the Committee in accordance with the procedure for compiling the Disciplinary Committee as approved by the Senate. (Replaced L.N. 112 of 2023)

If the Registrar does not receive sufficient acceptances of appointment to enable him to appoint a full Committee and subject to the power of the Senate to fill vacancies as provided in paragraph 3(3), the Chancellor shall fill vacancies in the Committee from members of the University as defined in Statute IV.
The teacher panel consists of 30 teachers (not being students) appointed by the Senate. (Replaced L.N. 112 of 2023)

Each member of the teacher panel shall appointed for a term of 1 year beginning on 1 July and terminating on 30 June in the following year or upon conclusion of a case upon which he may be then engaged with the Committee, whichever shall last occur, and shall be eligible for re-appointment.

If the Registrar fails to make any appointment from the teacher panel as required under paragraph 2(1)(a) such vacancy may be filled by the Senate by appointing a person from the Senate or from amongst the teachers as defined in section 12(9) of the Ordinance and Statute XII.

Neither the Vice-Chancellor nor the Dean of Student Affairs shall be eligible for appointment to the teacher panel or as a member of the Committee under the provisions of subparagraph (1) or (3) of paragraph 2 or subparagraph (3) of this paragraph. (Amended L.N. 165 of 1999; L.N. 112 of 2023)
The student panel consists of 30 students appointed by the Senate. (Replaced L.N. 112 of 2023)

Each member of the student panel shall be appointed for a term of one year beginning on 1 July and terminating on 30 June in the following year or upon conclusion of a case upon which he may then be engaged with the Committee, whichever shall last occur, and shall be eligible for re-appointment.

subsection.def: For the purposes of appointment to the student panel and proceedings before the Committee student (學生) shall not include a teacher or a full time employee of the University.

section.name: s5
section.content: The Registrar shall before 1 July of each year publish a list of the members of the Committee within their respective panels. (Amended L.N. 112 of 2023)

section.name: s6
section.content: The Chairman of the Committee must be a member of the teacher panel appointed in accordance with the procedure for compiling the Disciplinary Committee as approved by the Senate. (Replaced L.N. 112 of 2023)

subsection.content: The Registrar shall be the secretary to the Committee but shall not be a member thereof.
The Registrar may exercise his functions as secretary of the Committee by deputy. (Replaced L.N. 58 of 1976)

section.name: s8
section.content: At every meeting of the Committee involving consideration of a charge against a student there shall be present a solicitor appointed by the University who shall act as legal adviser to but not as a member of the Committee. (Amended L.N. 123 of 1994)

subsection.content: 3 members of the Committee shall form a quorum. If at any time during the hearing of a case involving a charge against a student there are less than 3 members of the Committee present then the proceedings in that case shall stand adjourned.

Any member of the Committee who is absent for any part of the hearing of a case involving a charge against a student shall cease to be a member of the Committee for the purpose of that case. (Replaced L.N. 123 of 1994)

If at any time before the hearing of a case involving a charge against a student it is decided by the Committee that a member of the Committee has a direct personal interest in the case which gives rise to a real danger of injustice, such member shall cease to be a member and the Registrar shall appoint a new member to the Committee in accordance with the provisions of paragraph 2(1). (Replaced L.N. 123 of 1994)

If at any time during the proceedings in respect of any case involving a charge against a student it is decided by the Committee that a member of the Committee has a direct personal interest in the case which gives rise to a real danger of injustice such member shall withdraw from the proceedings and shall cease to be a member of the Committee for the purposes of that case and shall not be a party to any decision subsequently made in respect of it. (Replaced L.N. 123 of 1994)

If at any time it appears to a member of the Committee that he has a direct personal interest in a case about to be brought before the Committee or being heard before the Committee, such member shall declare his interest to the Committee who shall decide whether or not such member shall withdraw under subparagraph (1) or (2).

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a decision as to the withdrawal of a member under this paragraph shall be made by a majority of the members of the Committee who are present and voting other than the member whose personal interest in the case is in question; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the event of an equality of votes the decision of the Committee shall be deemed to be that the member shall withdraw.

subsection.content: Where the withdrawal of a member has been ordered under this paragraph, the Committee shall forthwith determine whether it shall continue the current proceedings without that member or abandon the same and order a new hearing by the Committee in which the member so withdrawn shall not be a member.

section.name: s11
section.content: Decisions of the Committee shall be made by a majority of the members present and voting at a duly constituted meeting. In the event of an equality of votes the Chairman shall have a casting vote in addition to his original vote except in the case of a verdict of guilty or not guilty. Where an equality of votes occurs in relation to any such verdict upon a student a verdict of not guilty shall be recorded. (Added L.N. 19 of 1971)

section.name: s1
section.def: In this statute, unless the context otherwise requires, Committee (委員會) means the Disciplinary Committee appointed under paragraph 2 of Statute XXX. (Replaced L.N. 58 of 1976)

subsection.leadIn: The Committee shall investigate and make findings upon any complaint ordered to be brought before it by the Vice-Chancellor against a student who is alleged to have committed any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an offence for which the student has been convicted in any court of law;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: assault or battery against the person of any officer, member, employee or student of the University; (Amended L.N. 115 of 1991)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: defamation of any officer, member, employee or student of the University; (Amended L.N. 115 of 1991)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: wilful damage to or defacement of any property of any officer, member, employee or student of the University; (Amended L.N. 115 of 1991)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: wilful damage to or defacement of any property of the University or of approved halls and other accommodation approved for the residence of students, or use or occupation of the same otherwise than in accordance with the rules or other provision made therefor by the appropriate University authority; (Amended L.N. 123 of 1994)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: theft, fraud, misapplication of University funds or property of any kind; (Amended L.N. 123 of 1994)

paragraph.name: g
h
paragraph.content: falsification or serious misuse of University documents or records or both, including (without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing) certificates in connection with degrees and other academic distinctions;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: false pretences, misrepresentation, fraud or personation of others, within or without the University, in connection with academic attainments or financial awards, or otherwise in connection with the University;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.leadIn: refusal or failure to comply with any order of the Vice-Chancellor, or his representative, prohibiting any conduct which he has reasonable cause to believe is likely— (Amended L.N. 112 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to disrupt teaching, study, research or the administration of the University; (Amended L.N. 112 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to obstruct any officer or employee of the University in the performance of his duties; or (Amended L.N. 112 of 2023)
to bring the University into disrepute; (Added L.N. 112 of 2023)

paragraph.name: k
l
paragraph.leadIn: refusal or failure to comply with any order of any officer or teacher prohibiting conduct which he is reasonably satisfied—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: is obstructing any officer or employee of the University in the performance of his duties; or (Amended L.N. 112 of 2023)
is bringing the University into disrepute; (Added L.N. 112 of 2023)

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: refusal or failure to comply with any reasonable order of the warden of a hall relating to regulations governing residence made by the Senate or individual hall rules made in pursuance of such regulations;

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: maliciously and without reasonable cause laying a complaint against any officer, member, or employee of the University; (Replaced L.N. 72 of 1993)

def.name: Ragging
def.leadIn: ragging; without prejudice to the generality of the term, ragging (胡鬧) shall include conduct intended— (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to humiliate another student or hold him up to ridicule; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to interfere with the peaceable enjoyment by another student of his privileges, benefits, rights or facilities.

subsection.content: A complaint shall be addressed in writing to the Registrar and shall be considered to have been made when it is received by the Registrar. The Registrar shall inform the Vice-Chancellor within 7 days of the complaint, and the Vice-Chancellor shall then decide within 28 days whether a charge is to be brought against the student before the Disciplinary Committee. (Replaced L.N. 123 of 1994)

content.leadIn: No charge shall be brought before the Committee unless the complaint leading to the charge is made within 1 month of the time when the matter of such complaint arose:
content.proviso: Provided that if it is proved to the satisfaction of the Committee that the material facts relating to the complaint were or included facts of a decisive character which were at all times outside the knowledge (actual or constructive) of the complainant until a date which was after the end of the period of 1 month referred above, a charge may be brought before the Committee notwithstanding the expiry of the said period of 1 month. (Added L.N. 123 of 1994)

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: The Council shall have power to provide for and regulate— (Amended L.N. 123 of 1994)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the procedure to be followed in making appointments to the Committee and in connection with meetings of the Committee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conduct of all persons at any meeting of the Committee.

subsection.leadIn: The Committee may order the imposition upon any student found to be guilty of any of the offences specified in paragraph 2 any of the following penalties— (Amended L.N. 123 of 1994)

content.proviso: Provided that such reprimand shall form part of such student’s official record for the remainder of his or her studies in the curriculum concerned; (Replaced L.N. 123 of 1994)

paragraph.name: b
c
d
paragraph.content: suspension; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: expulsion from the University,

subsection.continued: and where applicable may require such student to make good any damage to property or premises caused by him:
subsection.proviso: Provided that where the Committee is satisfied that any damage to or defacement of property was accidentally caused it shall not impose any penalty on the student responsible for such damage to or defacement of property, but may require such student to make good the damage or defacement accidentally caused.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The Committee in addition to or as an alternative to imposing any of the penalties set out in subparagraph (1) may report to the Council and the Senate the offence of which the student has been found guilty where such offence falls within the provisions of paragraph 2(1)(g), (h) or (i) and has been committed in connection with a degree or other academic distinction conferred upon the student and the Council and the Senate may if they think fit, recommend to the Chancellor the deprivation of any degree, diploma, certificate or other academic distinction conferred upon such person. (Replaced L.N. 123 of 1994)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: Where a student has been found guilty of an offence which falls within the provisions of paragraph 2(1)(g), the Committee shall report such offence to the examiners appointed under Statute XXIX for the relevant examination who may then take such action within their competence as they consider appropriate. (Added L.N. 99 of 1997)

def.name: Suspension
def.leadIn: In this paragraph suspension (暫時停學) means the withdrawal of all academic or other University privileges, benefits, rights and facilities and during the period of suspension the student shall not be entitled to enter or remain on any property or premises of the University:
def.proviso: Provided that the Committee may in its discretion and taking into account the length of the period of suspension permit the student to remain eligible for the benefits of the University Health Service and the Personal Development and Counselling Centre. (Replaced L.N. 123 of 1994)

subsection.content: The Vice-Chancellor may at any time permit any student in respect of whom a penalty of suspension or withdrawal has been imposed to enter and remain on the property or premises of the University for such purposes as may be specified by the Vice-Chancellor in writing in letter addressed to the student.

Where under this paragraph or paragraph 8 a student is suspended his entitlement to take any examination shall be determined according to the regulations made by the Senate governing the conditions for the award of degrees, diplomas, certificates and other marks of distinction, and governing courses of study and examinations.

Where the Committee orders the imposition of any penalty the operation of any such order shall be suspended until expiration of 14 days after the day on which such order was made or such longer period as may be permitted by the Committee or by the Registrar for giving notice of appeal under paragraph 7. Where notice of appeal is given the operation of any such order shall be further suspended until the determination of the appeal. (Amended L.N. 167 of 1992)

section.name: s5
section.leadIn: Where it is alleged that a student has been convicted of an offence by a court of law the Committee shall confine its proceedings to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: hearing evidence in proof of conviction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: hearing evidence as to the sentence imposed by the court;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: hearing evidence given in mitigation of any penalty which may be imposed by the Committee; and

content.leadIn: the imposition, if it thinks fit, of any penalty which it is empowered to impose under paragraph 4 (except a fine where a fine has already been imposed by a court of law):
content.proviso: Provided that no penalty to withdrawal, suspension or expulsion shall be imposed unless it is satisfied that the continued presence of that student in the University or his continued enjoyment of any or all of its privileges, benefits, rights or facilities would be detrimental to the well-being of the University.

section.name: s6
section.content: The Committee may summon before it for the purpose of giving evidence at any hearing any student, teacher or employee of the University. Any failure to attend upon such summons by a student may be treated as an offence under paragraph 2(1)(k) and any such failure by a teacher or employee of the University may be referred by the Committee to the Council for further action.

content.leadIn: A right of appeal against any finding of or penalty imposed by the Committee shall lie within 14 days to the Council:
content.proviso: Provided that the University shall have no such right of appeal.

subsection.content: Notwithstanding the provisions of subparagraph (1), where the Committee has imposed a fine and where for the same offence a fine has subsequently been imposed by a court of law, a right of appeal for a remission of the fine imposed by the Committee in whole or in part shall lie to the Council within 30 days from the date of the imposition of the fine by the court.

content.leadIn: Notwithstanding the provisions of paragraph 4(4), pending the findings of the Committee concerning any complaint or pending an appeal to the Council against any finding of or penalty imposed by the Committee the Vice-Chancellor may, where he is satisfied that it is absolutely necessary for the protection of the members or the proper functioning of the University, temporarily withhold any privilege, benefit, right or facility from the student against whom the complaint has been brought or who has appealed to the Council; and this temporary withholding shall lapse 30 days after the order for it has been made unless the Vice-Chancellor specifically renews it for a further period; every period renewed by the Vice-Chancellor shall lapse 30 days after its date of renewal unless specifically further renewed:
content.proviso: Provided that pending appeal to the Council the Vice-Chancellor shall not exercise his power of withholding unless the Committee has imposed a like penalty of withdrawal.

subsection.content: Any period of temporary withholding imposed by the Vice-Chancellor under this paragraph shall be taken into account by the Committee in exercising its powers under paragraph 4 and by the Council in exercising its powers to review penalties on appeal. Any period of withdrawal imposed by the Committee or by the Council shall be deemed to include any period of temporary withholding imposed by the Vice-Chancellor under this paragraph.

section.name: s9
section.content: The commencement or non-commencement of civil or criminal proceedings against a student shall not prejudice, preclude or in any way restrict the powers of the Committee under this statute in so far as the same may be practicable.

section.name: s10
section.content: The proceedings of the Committee shall be conducted in camera. While the Committee considers its decision on any case before it the student and his representative and the University’s representative shall withdraw but shall thereafter return to hear the decision.

subsection.content: The findings of the Committee shall be posted on such notice-boards as may be specified by the Registrar, but a finding of “guilty” shall not be posted unless the time for appeal specified in paragraph 7(1) has elapsed and no appeal has been made to the Council. (Amended L.N. 167 of 1992)

For the purpose of this paragraph findings (裁斷) shall include the name of the student against whom the complaint was made, the nature of the offence complained of, the provision of the statute under which the complaint was brought, the decision of the Committee on the complaint, and the penalty, if any, imposed by the Committee. (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

section.name: s12
section.content: The Committee may exercise all or any of the powers conferred under this Statute notwithstanding that the person against whom a complaint has been made had ceased to be a student at the time of the complaint or at the time of the hearing by the Committee of the charge or at the time when the Committee makes its findings on the charge. (Replaced L.N. 123 of 1994)
